pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
It looks still good to me, thanks!

bors merge
bors r-
Canceled.
Sorry, I was working on another PR and I switched tab.
Can you please fix the conflict?
What's the status of this PR? I suggest we merge it first and golf it later as the proofs are already not that long.

I agree, we can golf it later. Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240548305/job/19723655370)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240548305/job/19723655490)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240548305/job/19723655327)

We have [Polynomial.card_roots_le_map_of_injective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/RingDivision.html#Polynomial.card_roots_le_map_of_injective) that looks very close, maybe you don't need this result? Or at least you can gold the proof.
I don't understand how that result can be used to prove this?
The result just looks similar to me, but I didn't try to prove it. Just ignore my comment if it is useless.

```suggestion
variable (hx : IsIntegral R x) {R x}
```
Because why not.
Here `x` and `y` can be implicit, but as you prefer.
Here `Nontrivial S` is not needed, right?
If `S` is trivial then `S[X]` is trivial so the degree of every polynomial is `0`.
I misread the statement, sorry.

```suggestion
lemma coeff_minpolyDiv_mem_adjoin (i) : coeff (minpolyDiv R x) i ∈ Algebra.adjoin R {x} := by
```
seems better.

```suggestion
lemma coeff_minpolyDiv_sub_pow_mem_span {i} (hi : i ≤ natDegree (minpolyDiv R x)) :
```

```suggestion
```
I think it is already opened.

```suggestion
    (x : L) (hxL : Algebra.adjoin K {x} = ⊤) {r : ℕ} (hr : r < finrank K L) :
```

Can you give the full name of `traceForm_dualBasis_powerBasis_eq`? Otherwise I think it will not clickable in the doc, and since it is in another file it can be confusing. Also, I think the description is a little misleading, you don't define the dual basis wrt to the trace (this is already in mathlib), you prove something about it (I guess this should also modified in the description of the PR).
This is in the root namespace, should it not be? (and also not in this file, I forgot to move this line)
The full name of `traceForm` is `Algebra.traceForm`, so I guess also this should be in the `Algebra` namespace. But if you move it to the right file is less important.
Anyway I think this fill should still mention it, since it is its main application.
Yes I kept the mention.

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Subalgebra.Pointwise ```

```suggestion
      (Algebra.adjoin R {x}).toSubmodule := by
```
This doesn't work because `Subalgebra.toSubmodule` is an order-embedding.

```suggestion
    {x : L} (hxL : Algebra.adjoin K {x} = ⊤) {r : ℕ} (hr : r < finrank K L) :
```
I created #9071 which may make some lemmas easier, including this.
I failed to use them to make the proofs shorter.

I'll try later. I think several lemmas could be easier using what we know about divByMonic, instead of using the characterization you introduced.

~~I've started wondering whether we should prove something general about upper/lower triangular matrices (with 1 on the diagonal) or such linear systems ...~~ but #9071 was merged really quickly (thanks!)
Edit: sorry there's probably nothing general. It's about the inverse of a particular type of bidiagonal matrix. There exists a [general formula](https://math.stackexchange.com/a/3700234/12932) for the inverse of bidiagonal matrices, but it's probably too complicated for the use case here.

It might help to prove the stronger statement that the submodule spanned by the first i coefficients is equal to that spanned by the first i powers of x.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Dual basis of power basis wrt trace form
